pullRequest.body:
---
<!-- The text above the `---` will become the commit message when your
PR is merged. Please leave a blank newline before the `---`, otherwise
GitHub will format the text above it as a title.

For details on the "pull request lifecycle" in mathlib, please see:
https://leanprover-community.github.io/contribute/index.html

In particular, note that most reviewers will only notice your PR
if it passes the continuous integration checks.
Please ask for help on https://leanprover.zulipchat.com if needed.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

If you are moving or deleting declarations, please include these lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Moves:
- Vector.* -> Mathlib.Vector.*
- ...

Deletions:
- Nat.bit1_add_bit1
- ...

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:
- [ ] depends on: #abc [optional extra text]
- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]

-->

[![Open in Gitpod](https://gitpod.io/button/open-in-gitpod.svg)](https://gitpod.io/from-referrer/)

nodes.body:
### PR summary [0822254a02](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/16545/commits/0822254a02d4efc2cf04c6cf38c87ed3f8f330fb)

#### Import changes for modified files

No significant changes to the import graph


<details><summary>Import changes for all files</summary>

|Files|Import difference|
|-|-|

</details>

---

<details><summary>

#### Declarations diff

</summary>

`+ HasSum.const_div`
`+ Summable.const_div`
`+ hasSum_const_div_iff`
`+ summable_const_div_iff`
`+ summable_pow_div_add`
`+ tendsto_const_div_atTop`
`+ tendsto_const_div_pow`
<details>
  <summary>You can run this locally as follows</summary>


```bash
## summary with just the declaration names:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh <optional_commit>

## more verbose report:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh long <optional_commit>
```
</details>

The doc-module for `script/declarations_diff.sh` contains some details about this script.

</details>
@CBirkbeck you resolved conversations and removed `awaiting-author`, but didn't do some of the things. Did you forget to push?

> @CBirkbeck you resolved conversations and removed `awaiting-author`, but didn't do some of the things. Did you forget to push?

Sorry yes! my train stop arrived sooner than expected and I rushed off forgetting to push!
What's the point of the power in `x ^ p`? It's just a constant wrt `n`, no?
good point!
Are we missing `Summable.const_div`?
yeah sure, I've added this and some similar results.

```suggestion
  have := summable_nat_add_iff (f := fun x => 1 / (x ^ q : )) k
```

Likely
```suggestion
  simpa only [hq, Nat.cast_add, one_div, norm_inv, norm_pow, Complex.norm_eq_abs,
    RCLike.norm_natCast, Real.summable_nat_pow_inv, iff_true]
    using summable_nat_add_iff (f := fun x => 1 / (x ^ q : )) k
```

```suggestion
lemma tendsto_const_div_pow (r : ) (k : ) (hk : k  0) :
```

```suggestion
  have h := Filter.Tendsto.const_mul r (l := atTop) (f := fun n :  => 1 / n^k) (c := 0) ?_
```
Are you missing a focusing dot somewhere?
yes thanks!
This should be true in higher generality. See [Filter.Tendsto.div_atTop](https://leanprover-community.github.io/mathlib4_docs/Mathlib/Topology/Algebra/Order/Field.html#Filter.Tendsto.div_atTop)

Ah yes that seems to be much more general. I've added a more general constant_div_atTop lemma and used it to prove the original one. I think its nice to have the specific one since its the one that shows up when doing L-series and modular form stuff. But if you think its not worth having as a lemma on its own I'm happy to remove it.

If you really want the specialized version, then I suppose I'm okay with it, but notice that your proof is more work than necessary. This works:
```lean
  simpa using tendsto_const_div_atTop _ r <| tendsto_natCast_atTop_atTop.comp (tendsto_pow_atTop hk)
```
Does `h.mul_left b` work here? Certainly `simpa only [mul_one_div] using h.mul_left b` should work.

Hang on, I see the issue, you need the Pi.inv_apply etc to simplify the hypothesis, not the goal. I'd be inclined to write the hypothesis as `HasSum (fun x \mapsto 1 / f x) a` which will shorten the proof, and also will probably make it easier to verify the hypotheses when this lemma is used. (Ditto for the other lemmas here.)
This still isn't general enough: it should have a generic type in place of `` and a generic filter in place of `atTop` (on ``). Also, it needs to be moved just after `Filter.Tendsto.div_atTop`.

You have this above
```suggestion
```
oops yes sorry!

I think this should be written in this form to match the other API.
```suggestion
theorem Summable.const_div (h : Summable (fun x  1 / f x)) (b : ) :
    Summable fun i  b / f i :=
  (h.hasSum.const_div b).summable
```

pullRequest.title: feat: add two limit results
